ctu_text: Agent visits the farmer and collects farmer details, land details and geo-tags the land through mobile app and generates a QR code (which carries information on farmer and land). The soil is taken to a STL where it is tested on 12 parameters. The SHC is generated after soil test on portal. The SHC gives crop recommendations and fertiliser recommendations (which crop should be grown on this soil type and how much and which fertiliser is best suited).

ctu_text: 110 for awareness"}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "The key objectives of the scheme are as follows:"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tTo promote soil test based nutrient management across the country"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tTo issue soil health cards to all farmers across the country"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tStrengthen the functioning of soil testing laboratories and associated infrastructure "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tCapacity building of district and state level staff for promotion of nutrient management practices"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u2022\tTo diagnose soil fertility related constraints with standardized procedures for sampling uniformly across states; and analyse and design fertilizer recommendations. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}], "benefitTypes": {"id": 2, "value": "in-kind", "label": "In Kind"}, "benefits": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "The scheme targets to provide following benefits:"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "1)\tProvide free / affordable access to soil test"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "2)\tProvide farmers with timely and accurate soil analysis results"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "3)\tFacilitate customized soil nutrient recommendations based on test results"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "4)\tEnable farmers to optimize their fertiliser use and minimise input costs, and hence avoid under- or over- application of fertiliser"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}], "exclusions": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}]}, "applicationProcess": [{"mode": "Offline", "process": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Step 01: Farmer approaches a District Agriculture Officer / Block Agriculture Officer for soil testing and generation of a SHC. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Step 02: The concerned officer shall initiate the process for the concerned farmer wherein they assess whether the applicant\u2019s district / village falls under State Annual Action Plan for generation of SHC. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Step 03: Agent visits the farmer and collects farmer details, land details and geo-tags the land through mobile app and takes a sample of the soil for testing"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Step 04: The soil is tested on set parameters and a Soil Health report is generated for the farmer\u2019s land"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Step 05: The report contains results as well as recommendations on suitable crops for the soil type, and the quantity and type of fertiliser to be used.

"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}], "process_md": "Step 01: Farmer approaches a District Agriculture Officer / Block Agriculture Officer for soil testing and generation of a SHC.
Step 02: The concerned officer shall initiate the process for the concerned farmer wherein they assess whether the applicant’s district / village falls under State Annual Action Plan for generation of SHC.
Step 03: Agent visits the farmer and collects farmer details, land details and geo-tags the land through mobile app and takes a sample of the soil for testing
Step 04: The soil is tested on set parameters and a Soil Health report is generated for the farmer’s land
Step 05: The report contains results as well as recommendations on suitable crops for the soil type, and the quantity and type of fertiliser to be used.

ctu_text: "}, {"question": "Can any farmer apply for a soil health card? ", "answer": "Yes, any farmer can apply for a soil health card for his/her land, through District Agriculture Office. "}, {"question": "How to apply for the scheme? ", "answer": "For generation of SHC, farmer should reach out to the District / State Nodal officer if he/she wants to get soil testing done for free.
